intro: Psychotria jinotegensis var. morazanensis, commonly known as the Morazan psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Central America, particularly found in Honduras and El Salvador. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, elliptical leaves, and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
